subject: Re: Thou shalt not always write isolated tests (was: [junit] Re: Expected exception pitfall and pattern)
msgSnippet: ... Sure. But I can do the same thing with flat test organization too. It just need to be correlated with package/class dependency relationship. Technically
messageBody:
CÃ©dric Beust ? wrote:
>> Cedric, but 2 + 2 still going to be 4 and you still will have to
>> investigate why above 10 cases failed...
>>
> Yes, but you know exactly where to start when you read "1 FAILURE, 9 SKIPS"
> as opposed to "10 FAILURES".
>
Sure. But I can do the same thing with flat test organization too. It
just need to be correlated with package/class dependency relationship.

Technically information you are hardcoding into your test hierarchy
can be obtained automatically and test runner can reorganize test cases
based on dependencies using quite simple static code analysis. Hey,
anyone would like to implement this idea?! :-)

regards,
Eugene
